title: R-Ladies Dublin: Mixed effect models in R  [Virtual] , Ireland, Europe
description:
Join us for a practical session on mixed-effects models in R

The talk will cover techniques used to implement and run mixed-effects models, specifically Linear Mixed Models (LMM) and Generalized Linear Mixed Models (GLMM) in R. It will also detail assumptions of the tests and common pitfalls in application. You’ll learn about the models in the context of common research examples from the areas of Psychology and Psycholinguistics.

Grab a snack and a drink and dial in on Monday, 23rd November, at 5:15PM (GMT)

5:15-5:20 Welcome
5:20-5:30 Introductions
5:30-7:00 Talk and tutorial: Mixed-effects models in R by Natalia Resende

Our speaker Natalia Resende is a Marie Skłodowska-Curie research fellow at Adapt Centre, School of Computing, Dublin City University. Her expertise is in the domains of Psycholinguistics, Natural Language Processing and Machine Translation. More recently, her work focuses on investigating how machine translation systems (such as the popular Google Translate system) impact the processing of English as a second language in the human brain. Natália Resende graduated in English teaching from Federal University of Minas Gerais, Brazil. She has received her PhD in Psycholinguistics from the Federal University of Santa Catarina, Brazil in 2015 and her masters in Natural Language Processing from Wolverhampton University, United Kingdom, in 2009.

This is a practical session. You’ll need to install RStudio or use R Studio Cloud https://rstudio.cloud/.

We'll be recording the event for future reference, we hope that’s ok with you.

See you on the Internet :)
Jo, Paola and Sapna

title: R-Ladies Belo Horizonte: We R Ladies - Como criar um pacote do zero no R  [Virtual] , Brazil, Latin America
description:
Inscrições em: https://www.sympla.com.br/we-r-ladies---como-criar-um-pacote-do-zero-no-r__1043808

Para quem usa o software R frequentemente, a utilização de pacotes pode economizar tempo e ajudar a organizar projetos. Neste curso, iremos abordar todo o processo de criação de pacotes, assim como suas utilidades e aplicações. Para facilitar o desenvolvimento usaremos ferramentas disponíveis no RStudio Cloud.

Nível de Habilidade: Intermediário

Conheça a facilitadora:

Adriana dos Santos Lima - Cientista de Dados na Accenture (https://www.linkedin.com/in/adriana-lima-89a11b143/)
Carioca em Beagá. Adriana é graduada em Estatística pela UFF (Universidade Federal Fluminense) e Mestre em Estatística pela UFMG (Universidade Federal de Minas Gerais).
Cientista de dados nos dias úteis e espectadora fiel dos vídeos de decoração aos finais de semana. Trabalha atualmente na Accenture como Cientista de Dados onde atua em projetos que a permitem desenvolver desde o pré-processamento dos dados até a aplicação dos modelos de machine learning.
Apaixonadíssima pelo R, mas desenvolvendo uma leve paixonite pelo python nos últimos tempos. Acredita que programar é para TODOS e que o conhecimento em programação deve ser disseminado por aí. A sua paixão mesmo é estudar Estatística nas suas mais diversas áreas (a louca, né?) e recentemente decidiu se aventurar no mundo do Deep Learning.

FAQs:

O que é R?

R é uma linguagem de programação de computador e ambiente de software para computação estatística e gráficos. Confira aqui (https://www.r-project.org/). Ele é usado para análise e visualização de dados em uma ampla variedade de campos.

O que é R-Ladies?

A comunidade R-Ladies é uma organização global que promove a diversidade de gênero na comunidade da linguagem computacional estatística (R). Embora nossos eventos considerem pelo menos o interesse de nível básico em R (algum conhecimento anterior é útil, mas não obrigatório), você é mais que bem-vinde a participar de qualquer uma de nossas sessões para ver o que fazemos.

Onde posso acessar seus materiais?

Vamos carregar os materiais para a nossa pasta no GDrive (https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1UNO_46lSQ63aU71tIR70-7le0ez10HT5).

Eu conheço pouco ou nada sobre a linguagem R, ainda assim posso participar?

Absolutamente! Todos os níveis são bem-vindos, tudo o que você precisa é ter pelo menos algum interesse.

Preciso de alguma estrutura pra acompanhar o curso?

Para acompanhar o curso online, o ideal é ter acesso a um computador e internet rápida. Uma conta ativa no RStudio Cloud também será necessária. Veja como criá-la aqui: https://medium.com/rladiesbh/r-studio-cloud-como-programar-em-r-usando-a-web-aa6313a5fb8c

Vai ter certificado?

Vai sim, todo mundo que comparecer ao evento terá direito a um certificado de 6h.

O curso é gratuito?

Sim. Porém, teremos um número limitado de vagas gratuitas.

Eu sou homem, posso me inscrever?

Este grupo é principalmente voltado para o público feminino e LGBTQIA+, mas está aberto a todos que concordam com o CoC (https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/). Dito isto, se você é um homem e quer participar dos nossos encontros, você está convidado a participar!

Projeto a ser ajudado em breve!

Ficou alguma dúvida?

É só enviar para [masked] ;)

title: R-Ladies Milan: Recommendation Engine from scratch!  [Virtual] , Italy, Europe
description:
Ciao di nuovo!
Siamo qui per un evento interessante:
Volete aggiornare il vostro skill set e imparare a costruire un sistema di raccomandazione da zero? Questo evento fa per voi!
Siamo lieti di ospitare un workshop virtuale con Avanade, leader mondiale nella fornitura di servizi digitali innovativi, cloud, business solutions ed experience design.
In questo workshop imparerete:
* Costruzione di un Recommendation System tramite la libreria recommenderlab, allo scopo di suggerire delle “categorie letterarie” a utenti che comprano libri.
Il workshop sarà suddiviso in diversi step, dall’analisi del dataset alla costruzione di KPI, fino all’implementazione del modello di raccomandazione. Come ultimo step, per mostrare come usufruire del modello, mostreremo una ShinyApp che, prendendo in input alcune informazioni sui gusti dell’utente, restituisce le categorie suggerite

Level: Beginner
Il materiale per il workshop sarà condiviso prima dell'evento.

Speakers:
- Intro: Simona Radici, Talent Acquisition specialist e Giovanni Vetrella, Advanced Analytics Talent Community Lead.
- Hands on Lab: Michela Isella e Adriana Santacroce, Advanced Analytics Consultant e Advanced Analytics Analyst.

* Michela Isella, Laureata in Fisica, Data Scientist in Avanade. Parte del team di Advanced Analytics, specializzata nello sviluppo di soluzioni di Machine Learning tramite servizi del Cloud Microsoft Azure.
* Adriana Santacroce, ha un dottorato di ricerca nel campo statistico-demografico. Attualmente lavora nel team di Advanced Analytics di Avanade.

Ricordate che per questo workshop e' necessario aver installato R & Rstudio sul vostro pc. L'evento sarà in Italiano e sarà trasmesso in streaming tramite Zoom (Non è necessario installare zoom).
Il link per partecipare verrà condiviso dopo la registrazione.

Agenda:
- Introduzione: 17.30 - 17.45
- Workshop:[masked]
- Q&A: 18.30 - 18.45

Looking forward to meeting up with you all!
Interested to give a talk or collaborate with us on an event? Reach us!

description:

title: R-Ladies Queretaro: Experimento conductual y optogenética: Análisis estadístico básico en R  [Virtual] , Mexico, Latin America
description:
En este taller revisaremos estadística en R de datos obtenidos de experimentos con la Dra. Sofia González Salinas.

Sofia González Salinas es investigadora postdoctoral en la Universidad de Rutgers en Nueva Jersey y estudia las bases neurobiológicas de la conducta materna y de los desórdenes del ánimo. Realizó sus estudios de licenciatura y doctorado en la UNAM. Utiliza R para analizar diversos tipos de datos tales como medidas conductuales en roedores, análisis de la expresión génica mediante qPCR, baterías psicológicas y potenciales relacionados con eventos.

Sofia.- En este taller los llevaré de la mano para conocer el diseño experimental y el análisis de datos empleando R de un estudio de conducta materna donde empleo la técnica de optogenética.

Te esperamos para seguir aprendiendo juntxs!!!

title: Central Iowa R User Group: R and Python study group, United States, US/Canada
description:
Until we can meet again in person, please join our Slack workspace to stay in touch, ask questions, and share information throughout the week.

https://join.slack.com/t/centraliowarusergroup/shared_invite/zt-dhfa5ude-0tvHascxRkn2pgiqDdQgrw

The Slack workspace is available any time, not just Saturday mornings.

Are you tired of learning and playing with Python and R alone? Would you like to get together with a few friends and learn together? I have been starting to learn R and Python for data science and following the typical route of videos and practice projects. I really want to ramp up my learning and exposure to different ways. Here is my proposal:

- Gather a small group of 2-5 and learn together.
- Meet at a coffee shop, library, or some other space that has Wi-Fi.
- Pick a project, data set or problem, then work to solve it with different tools.
- Keep it fluid and informal.
- Meet on a regular basis, say weekly to start, and adjust as needed.
- Aim to keep the meetings 2-4 hours long, but this can be adjusted to the project or group. People can come and go as needed.
- It does not have to be the same people each time, so you only have to commit to going once to check it out.

Are you interested? Show up at the meeting spot, have some coffee, meet new friends and bring a project or question.

description:
Masz podstawowe doświadczenia z programowaniem i chciałbyś poznać nowe, fascynujące i przyjemne języki? Już niedługo będziesz mógł nauczyć się Pythona oraz R na warsztatach "PoweR" 🔥🔥🔥

📌 9.12 Podstawy Python
📌 14.12 Analiza danych w R
📌 16.12 Analiza danych w Python
📌 21.12 Wizualizacja danych w R
📌 23.12 Wizualizacja danych w Python
w godzinach 19:00 - 21:00

➡ Lingaro

Organizatorzy:
🔹 Warszawskie Spotkania Entuzjastów R
🔸 R Ladies Warsaw
🔹 Koło Naukowe Data Science PW
🔸 MI2DataLab

# Link do warsztatu https://youtu.be/z41LrbWZJwo

# Opis
Na warsztatach poznamy jak tworzyć poprawne wizualizacje, jakich błędów się wystrzegać. Początkowo będziemy pracować z użyciem podstawowych wykresów w R. Następnie zapoznamy się z biblioteką ggplot2, sposobem jej funkcjonowania oraz dużą liczbą przykładów, żeby zobaczyć jej ogromne możliwości w tworzeniu wizualizacji.

# Prowadzący
Ania jest absolwentką Statystyki Matematycznej i Analizy Danych na Politechnice Warszawskiej oraz pracuje jako Data Scientist. Związana z MI2 Data Lab oraz Kołem Naukowym Data Science. W wolnych chwilach organizuje i prowadzi warsztaty (SER Warsaw, R Ladies Warsaw) związane z popularyzacją języka R. Jest autorką pakietu R vivo.

title: CopenhagenR - useR Group: Bayesian Multilevel Modeling with {brms}  [Virtual] , Denmark, Europe
description:
The {brms} package provides an interface to fit Bayesian generalized (non-)linear multivariate multilevel models using Stan, a C++ package for performing full Bayesian inference (see https://mc-stan.org/). The formula syntax is very similar to that of the {lme4} package to provide a familiar and simple interface for performing regression analyses. A wide range of response distributions are supported, allowing users to fit – among others – linear, robust linear, count data, survival, response times, ordinal, zero-inflated, and even self-defined mixture models all in a multilevel context. Further modeling options include non-linear and smooth terms, auto-correlation structures, censored data, missing value imputation, and quite a few more. In addition, all parameters of the response distribution can be predicted in order to perform distributional regression. Multivariate models, i.e., models with multiple response variables, can be fit as well. Prior specifications are flexible and explicitly encourage users to apply prior distributions that reflect their beliefs. Model fits can easily be assessed and compared with posterior predictive checks, cross-validation, and Bayes factors.

[Bio]
Paul is a statistician currently working as an Independent Junior Research Group Leader at the Cluster of Excellence SimTech at the University of Stuttgart (Germany). He is the author of the R package {brms} and member of the Stan Development Team. Previously, he studied Psychology and Mathematics at the Universities of Münster and Hagen (Germany) and did his PhD in Münster about optimal design and Bayesian data analysis. He has also worked as a Postdoctoral researcher at the Department of Computer Science at Aalto University (Finland).

[About]
This event is organized by the Oslo useR! Group and will be co-hosted by the Skåne useR! Group, the Copenhagen useR! Group, and the Stockholm useR! Group.

title: Wiesbaden R User Group: R Coffee Break - Vorstellung von schoRsch  [Virtual] , Germany, Europe
description:
Hallo liebe R User,

Die R Coffee Break gibt einen kurzen Einblick (5 bis 10 Minuten) in ein R- Thema. Als Plattform nutzen wir Zoom.
Und ganz wie die gepflegte Kaffeepause im Büro wird das Meetup am Nachmittag stattfinden und insgesamt nicht länger als 15 Minuten in Anspruch nehmen.

In dieser RCoffeeBreak freuen wir uns auf einen Vortrag von Roland Pfister. Er wird uns das Paket schoRsch vorstellen. SchoRsch richtet sich an Psychologen und Verhaltensforscher, die routinemäßig mit experimentellen Daten aus faktoriellen Experimenten arbeiten.

Wir freuen uns schon darauf euch auch bei diesem Meetup begrüßen zu dürfen. Die Zugangsdaten werden wie immer am Tag des Vortrags ab 12 Uhr hier bereitgestellt.

Kenncode: tbd

title: Sydney Users of  R Forum (SURF): AlphaZetta Global Analytics Summit - Sydney 2021, Australia, Australia
description:
Registration is required on the AlphaZetta site - links below.

The AlphaZetta Global Analytics Summit is a unique conference experience, built around experts sharing their knowledge, use cases, best practice and having time for meaningful interactions. It is not vendor driven - there’s no booths or selling and no big crowds - we expect only ~150 attendees. The summit provides insightful presentations, fantastic networking and discussion time at great value!

We are delighted that the next GAS will be held in Sydney on Friday 5th March at the Manly Pacific Hotel. Further details including the agenda can be found here ( https://alphazetta.ai/event/global-analytics-summit-sydney-2020/ ).

The day starts with presentations on the current state of the analytics market and key trends to look for in the future. The second section is about inspiring attendees with keynotes from Volt Bank on creating a new business based on data and analytics and from Raiffeisen Bank on building an analytics team to provide true value to the whole organisation.

The afternoon focuses on innovation and implementation. We have presentations from some of Australia’s exciting startups (Volt, Adgile Media, Self Assured Pty Ltd) who are using analytics to disrupt their markets. To close, we will hear a keynote on how to deliver analytics and increase AI adoption.

The Summit venue is the Novotel Pacific, Manly which is right on the ocean beach, with lunch and dinner included.

All up, at just $350 for standard tickets, it’s a conference like no other!

Presenters Include:

Steve Weston - Co-Founder and CEO, Volt Bank

Stephen Brobst - AlphaZetta Advisory Board; Chief Technology Officer, Teradata; TDWI Fellow

Felipe Flores - Founder, Data Futurology; GM Data Science and Analytics, Liberty Financial

Markus Lochner - Head of Group Digital Solutions, Raiffeisen Bank International

Tony Ohlsson - Founder, AlphaZetta; Chief Analytics Officer, Volt Bank

Eugene Dubossarsky - Chief Data Scientist | Managing Partner of AlphaZetta Academy

PLEASE DO NOT RSVP ON MEETUP.COM.
Further details including the agenda can be found here ( https://alphazetta.ai/event/global-analytics-summit-sydney-2020/ )

title: Melbourne Users of R Network (MelbURN): AlphaZetta Global Analytics Summit - Sydney 2021, Australia, Australia
description:
Registration is required on the AlphaZetta site - links below.

The AlphaZetta Global Analytics Summit is a unique conference experience, built around experts sharing their knowledge, use cases, best practice and having time for meaningful interactions. It is not vendor driven - there’s no booths or selling and no big crowds - we expect only ~150 attendees. The summit provides insightful presentations, fantastic networking and discussion time at great value!

We are delighted that the next GAS will be held in Sydney on Friday 5th March at the Manly Pacific Hotel. Further details including the agenda can be found here ( https://alphazetta.ai/event/global-analytics-summit-sydney-2020/ ).

The day starts with presentations on the current state of the analytics market and key trends to look for in the future. The second section is about inspiring attendees with keynotes from Volt Bank on creating a new business based on data and analytics and from Raiffeisen Bank on building an analytics team to provide true value to the whole organisation.

The afternoon focuses on innovation and implementation. We have presentations from some of Australia’s exciting startups (Volt, Adgile Media, Self Assured Pty Ltd) who are using analytics to disrupt their markets. To close, we will hear a keynote on how to deliver analytics and increase AI adoption.

The Summit venue is the Novotel Pacific, Manly which is right on the ocean beach, with lunch and dinner included.

All up, at just $350 for standard tickets, it’s a conference like no other!

Here’s a video clip to highlight all of the above! (https://youtu.be/YKnFo0thEMM)

Presenters Include:

title: Barcelona R User Group: Online event by: Oslo useR! Group (Bayesian Multilevel Modeling with {brms})  [Virtual] , Spain, Europe
description:
Hello everyone! We would like to invite you to join a fellow R group event organised online. Please see event details below:

Details
[About]
This event is organized by the Oslo useR! Group (https://www.meetup.com/Oslo-useR-Group/) and will be co-hosted by the Skåne useR! Group (https://www.meetup.com/Skane-R-User-Group/), the Copenhagen useR! Group (https://www.meetup.com/CopenhagenR-useR-Group/), and the Stockholm useR! Group (https://www.meetup.com/StockholmR/).

[Abstract]
The {brms} package provides an interface to fit Bayesian generalized (non-)linear multivariate multilevel models using Stan, a C++ package for performing full Bayesian inference (see https://mc-stan.org/). The formula syntax is very similar to that of the {lme4} package to provide a familiar and simple interface for performing regression analyses. A wide range of response distributions are supported, allowing users to fit – among others – linear, robust linear, count data, survival, response times, ordinal, zero-inflated, and even self-defined mixture models all in a multilevel context. Further modeling options include non-linear and smooth terms, auto-correlation structures, censored data, missing value imputation, and quite a few more. In addition, all parameters of the response distribution can be predicted in order to perform distributional regression. Multivariate models, i.e., models with multiple response variables, can be fit as well. Prior specifications are flexible and explicitly encourage users to apply prior distributions that reflect their beliefs. Model fits can easily be assessed and compared with posterior predictive checks, cross-validation, and Bayes factors.

[Bio]
Paul is a statistician currently working as an Independent Junior Research Group Leader at the Cluster of Excellence SimTech at the University of Stuttgart (Germany). He is the author of the R package {brms} and member of the Stan Development Team. Previously, he studied Psychology and Mathematics at the Universities of Münster and Hagen (Germany) and did his PhD in Münster about optimal design and Bayesian data analysis. He has also worked as a Postdoctoral researcher at the Department of Computer Science at Aalto University (Finland).

title: Campus useR Group Frankfurt: January meeting: Academic writing with R  [Virtual] , Germany, Europe
description:
We hit 2021 running with a session on academic writing with R.
There are layers to unpack: RMarkdown, LaTeX, Citations, .*down$ packages and custom templates... In a freestyle format, we share our workflows, questions, ideas, best practices and train-wreck experiences with compiling sleek scientific papers from R. What's keeping *you* from publishing your reproducible research with R?

As always, useRs of all walks of life and at all levels of expertise are invited to participate. Learning R is not a competition. Come join us!

title: R-Ladies Philly: Introduction to R dashboard development with Shiny Dashboard  [Virtual] , United States, US/Canada
description:
This introduction to Shiny Dashboards is for people who are interested in creating multi-Shiny app dashboards in R using the “shinydashboard” package. Topics such as reactivity, appearance (i.e. dashboard themes), profiling, and deployment will be covered. Over the course of the workshop, users will learn how to go from a raw data file to a working multi-app dashboard that can be updated based on user input.

The workshop will be suitable for beginner to intermediate R users or for those who are new to dashboard and app development. Former experience with Shiny is not necessary for this workshop. Some familiarity with R and/or data visualization methods would be helpful and assumed but not required, so novice users are encouraged to attend.

Speaker

Anastasia Lucas is a data analyst working in biomedical informatics and computational genomics research at the University of Pennsylvania’s Perelman School of Medicine. Her work in R mainly focuses on statistical analysis, package development, and data visualization.

title: R-Ladies Rotterdam: Microbenchmarking: measuring and improving R code performance  [Virtual] , Netherlands, Europe
description:
Welcome!

We are so thrilled to have Semiramis Castro as our speaker in our last event of the year. In this session we will discuss the core concepts about Microbenchmarking - that is, how to measure and improve performance of R code. We will base this session on chapter 23 and 24 of the Advanced R book (https://adv-r.hadley.nz/) by Hadley Wickham.

About R-Ladies NL book club
----------------------
This is the grand finale of a series of events based on Hadley Wickham's Advanced R book, hosted by R-Ladies chapters of the Netherlands.

You can find the slides and materials from previous sessions at: https://github.com/rladiesnl/book_club

About Semiramis
----------------------
Semiramis is a software developer/data scientist who codes mainly in R and Python. She's a recent PhD graduate from the National Autonomous University of Mexico with a focus on genomics of pathogenic bacteria and antibiotic resistance. Among the bacteria she studied are the emerging pathogen Acinetobacter haemolyticus and the deadly Acinetobacter baumannii.

Event link
----------------------
We host our events in Jitsi (Note that Jitsi works best with chrome)

Link will be posted here on the day of the event

Code of Conduct
----------------------------
We expect all attendees to abide by our Code of Conduct. Anyone who violates this community's Code of Conduct will be refused entry, expelled, and/or any other action deemed appropriate by the Organizer, regardless of event registration, meetup membership or other condition. We are emphatically queer and trans-friendly. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. Please read the Code of Conduct here: https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/

title: R-Ladies Freiburg: {R-Ladies Toolbox Series} Part 1: Academic Analysis   [Virtual] , Germany, Europe
description:
R-Ladies Toolbox Series - Essentials for women and minority genders in academia, science and data analysis presents:

Academic Analysis by Praveena Mathews (R-Ladies Chennai)

Calling all students, academics, and women in science! R-Ladies Freiburg presents a five-part guest series aimed at women and gender minorities in academia, science and data analysis, from first semester students to tenured researchers. Leading R-Ladies from around the world will lead us through the most fundamental steps to studying and working in academia, from analyzing results, to presenting them clearly, ensuring their reproducibility, and keeping track of all your changes. The series will close with a panel discussion from women around the world, who will speak about their experiences with science.

This series is funded by the “Pädagogische Hochschule Freiburg”, the University of Education in Freiburg.

Participants who take part in all five meetups can receive a certificate of participation.

Everyone is welcome to join and we hope for a warm exchange between students and researchers, as well as R-Ladies from the wider community.

title: R-Ladies Freiburg: {Part 1: Intro} From Zero to (s)Hero: Multi-part intro to R  [Virtual] , Germany, Europe
description:
Just getting involved with R or want to level up your skills? Have you used base-R but are still trying to wrap your head around the tidyverse "pipe" (%>%)? Have a messy dataset and don't know where to start? Seen beautiful visualizations on Twitter and want to make your own?

If you’ve answered ‘yes’ to at least one of these questions, fear no more! In this monthly workshop series, we will walk you through the fundamental uses of tidyverse and ggplot at your own pace with the help of hands-on exercises. Tidyverse and ggplot are a classic combination of R packages that allow you to "wrangle" your unwieldy data into whatever shape you need and creative beautiful and informative visualizations.

Over the course of this series, you will learn the most useful features of R Studio and R Markdown, how to read in and explore data, and transform it into a shape that's easy to work with. You will be able to create new columns and summary tables, subset interesting rows or columns, and combine and reshape dataframes. We will also dive into ggplot, one of the best tools for creating great-looking bar charts, scatterplots, and more!

This is (currently) a five-part series, aimed at total beginners and/or people with some experience in base-R or tidyverse who are looking to freshen up or expand their skills. Feel free to join at any point, we will briefly review the previous topic at the beginning of each session.

January 20th {Part 1}: The R & R-Studio ABCs (packages, files, data types & basic data exploration)
February 17th {Part 2}: Tidy data & introduction to data wrangling (tibbles, renaming, reordering, subsetting)
March 17th {Part 3}: Data wrangling with dplyr (new columns, if-else statements, summary tables, joining dataframes)
April 21st {Part 4}: Introduction to visualizations with ggplot (line graphs, bar charts, scatterplots, histograms, and more!)
May 19th {Part 5}: Advanced topics in wrangling and ggplot (pivoting, ggplot style options, etc.)

Please install R and R-Studio before joining: https://rstudio-education.github.io/hopr/starting.html

Image by the amazing @allison_horst: https://github.com/allisonhorst/stats-illustrations

title: R-Ladies Baltimore: R-Ladies Baltimore -- An introduction to the R/Bioconductor Ecosystem (Virtual)  [Virtual] , United States, US/Canada
description:
R-Ladies Baltimore (Bmore) is the local Baltimore chapter for the larger R-Ladies global organization (rladies.org) to promote gender diversity in the R community.

The next event is Thursday January 28, 2021 from 3-4:30pm (virtual meetup on Zoom). We will have an exciting presentation from Jocelyn Chavez (https://josschavezf.netlify.app) a Ph.D. student at the Biotechnology Institute-UNAM in Mexico! She will give an introduction to the R/Bioconductor (http://bioconductor.org) ecosystem, using Bioconductor packages, contributing packages, how to get help, attending the annual conference, and also sharing her experience with Bioconductor in general. If you haven't heard of Bioconductor, you can think of it like a cousin to CRAN, but for the analysis of biological data.

WHO is this for?
- If you are new to R & want to know more about what is Bioconductor!
- If you work with biological data in R, but are unfamiliar with Bioconductor!
- If you are interested contributing to Bioconductor to analyze biological data!

*If any/all of this is true, this event might be for you!*

AGENDA
3:00–3:15pm Who we are | Announcements | What's next
3:15–4pm Presentation: An introduction to the R/Bioconductor Ecosystem
4–4:30pm Networking -- Any more Qs?

Details on the location:
The Zoom information will be sent to those who RSVP the week before the event.

FAQ:
Q: Are men welcome to attend R-Ladies events?
A: Yes, men are welcome at this event. Our mission is to encourage more women and non-binary individuals to get involved in the R community. However, we ask that cis men come as guests of women and gender minorities to our events to promote a sense support and encouragement for women and gender minorities in the R community. Please help us by spreading the word about R-Ladies. Please also take the time to review our code of conduct before you attend: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

The term "women and gender minorities" is inclusive of individuals who identify as female (trans and cis), trans-men, non-binary, genderqueer, genderfluid, agender, intersex, and all minority genders).

Important to know:
- If this is your first R-Ladies event, please take a moment to review our R-Ladies Global code of conduct: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

Finally, for more information:

title: R-Ladies Baltimore: R-Ladies Bmore -- Let's get meta: analyzing your R code with tidycode (Virtual)  [Virtual] , United States, US/Canada
description:
R-Ladies Baltimore (Bmore) is the local Baltimore chapter for the larger R-Ladies global organization (rladies.org) to promote gender diversity in the R community.

The next event is Thursday February 11, 2021 from 3-4:30pm (virtual meetup on Zoom). We will have an exciting presentation from Lucy D'Agostino McGowan (https://www.lucymcgowan.com) an Assistant Professor in Statistics, Wake Forest University. She will give a presentation on two R packages: matahari (https://github.com/jhudsl/matahari) and tidycode (https://lucymcgowan.github.io/tidycode/). The matahari package is a simple package for tidy logging of everything you type into the R console. The tidycode package allows users to analyze R expressions in a tidy way (i.e. take the code captured from matahari and put it in a tidy table for downstream analysis with the tidyverse).

WHO is this for?
- If you are new to R & want to see some cool things R can do!
- If you work with messy R expressions and want to know how to tidy them up!

*If any/all of this is true, this event might be for you!*

AGENDA
3:00–3:15pm Who we are | Announcements | What's next
3:15–4pm Presentation: Let's get meta: analyzing your R code with tidycode
4–4:30pm Networking -- Any more Qs?

The Zoom information will be sent to those who RSVP the week before the event.

However, we ask that cis men come as guests of women and gender minorities to our events to promote a sense support and encouragement for women and gender minorities in the R community. Please help us by spreading the word about R-Ladies. Please also take the time to review our code of conduct before you attend: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

The term "women and gender minorities" is inclusive of individuals who identify as female (trans and cis), trans-men, non-binary, genderqueer, genderfluid, agender, intersex, and all minority genders).

title: R-Ladies Washington D.C.: Books In Bars - Algorithms of Oppression  [Virtual] , United States, US/Canada
description:
Spend Friday night discussing Algorithms of Oppression (https://www.bookdepository.com/Algorithms-Oppression-Safiya-Umoja-Noble/9781479837243).

A revealing look at how negative biases against women of color are embedded in search engine results and algorithms

Run a Google search for "black girls"-what will you find? "Big Booty" and other sexually explicit terms are likely to come up as top search terms. But, if you type in "white girls," the results are radically different. The suggested porn sites and un-moderated discussions about "why black women are so sassy" or "why black women are so angry" presents a disturbing portrait of black womanhood in modern society.

In Algorithms of Oppression, Safiya Umoja Noble challenges the idea that search engines like Google offer an equal playing field for all forms of ideas, identities, and activities. Data discrimination is a real social problem; Noble argues that the combination of private interests in promoting certain sites, along with the monopoly status of a relatively small number of Internet search engines, leads to a biased set of search algorithms that privilege whiteness and discriminate against people of color, specifically women of color.

Through an analysis of textual and media searches as well as extensive research on paid online advertising, Noble exposes a culture of racism and sexism in the way discoverability is created online. As search engines and their related companies grow in importance-operating as a source for email, a major vehicle for primary and secondary school learning, and beyond-understanding and reversing these disquieting trends and discriminatory practices is of utmost importance.

An original, surprising and, at times, disturbing account of bias on the internet, Algorithms of Oppression contributes to our understanding of how racism is created, maintained, and disseminated in the 21st century.

PS Please contact the organizer if you need support finding the book.

title: Canberra R Users Group: AlphaZetta Global Analytics Summit - Sydney 2021, Australia, Australia
description:
Registration is required on the AlphaZetta site - links below.

The AlphaZetta Global Analytics Summit is a unique conference experience, built around experts sharing their knowledge, use cases, best practice and having time for meaningful interactions. It is not vendor driven - there’s no booths or selling and no big crowds - we expect only ~150 attendees. The summit provides insightful presentations, fantastic networking and discussion time at great value!

We are delighted that the next GAS will be held in Sydney on Friday 5th March at the Manly Pacific Hotel. Further details including the agenda can be found here ( https://alphazetta.ai/event/global-analytics-summit-sydney-2020/ ).

The day starts with presentations on the current state of the analytics market and key trends to look for in the future. The second section is about inspiring attendees with keynotes from Volt Bank on creating a new business based on data and analytics and from Raiffeisen Bank on building an analytics team to provide true value to the whole organisation.

The afternoon focuses on innovation and implementation. We have presentations from some of Australia’s exciting startups (Volt, Adgile Media, Self Assured Pty Ltd) who are using analytics to disrupt their markets. To close, we will hear a keynote on how to deliver analytics and increase AI adoption.

The Summit venue is the Novotel Pacific, Manly which is right on the ocean beach, with lunch and dinner included.

All up, at just $350 for standard tickets, it’s a conference like no other!

Here’s a video clip to highlight all of the above! (https://youtu.be/YKnFo0thEMM)

Presenters Include:
Steve Weston - Co-Founder and CEO, Volt Bank
Stephen Brobst - AlphaZetta Advisory Board; Chief Technology Officer, Teradata; TDWI Fellow
Felipe Flores - Founder, Data Futurology; GM Data Science and Analytics, Liberty Financial
Martin Endrizal, BI Application Operations Manager, Vodafone Czech Republic
Markus Lochner - Head of Group Digital Solutions, Raiffeisen Bank International
Tony Ohlsson - Founder, AlphaZetta; Chief Analytics Officer, Volt Bank

PLEASE DO NOT RSVP ON MEETUP.COM.
Further details including the agenda can be found here ( https://alphazetta.ai/event/global-analytics-summit-sydney-2020/ )
Tickets are available here ( https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/global-analytics-summit-sydney-2020-tickets-85943209453 )

title: R-Ladies RTP: Introduction to R Packages for Bayesian Models  [Virtual] , United States, US/Canada
description:
At this virtual meetup, R-Ladies RTP member Melissa Wong (she/her), will introduce some R packages (rstanarm, rethinking, and possibly brms) for Bayesian models that are a bit easier to get started with than rstan. Melissa will include examples of both a simple linear regression and a semi-parametric regression in all packages, and talk about what she found to be a beginner-friendly path to work up to using rstan directly.

Melissa's Bio: I'm a Senior Engineer with The Johns Hopkins University Applied Physics Laboratory. I started my career as a software and systems engineer. Since finishing my M.S. in Statistics I've become interested in learning more about Bayesian methods and causal inference.

Special thanks to Melissa for suggesting, developing, and leading this meetup!

What do I bring?
Please login to Zoom using a laptop or computer with the capabilities to run R and RStudio. We encourage attendees to install or update their versions of R and RStudio as well as their R packages. To update your R Packages in RStudio go to Tools > "Check for package updates...". Here are links to free downloads for R (https://cran.r-project.org/) and RStudio (https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/#download). Downloading and installing both of these programs before this meetup will help us keep on schedule and make sure you learn the most you can while at the meetup event.

Who is this event for?
Beginners are welcome and encouraged to join this event but please install the most recent version of both R and RStudio on your laptop before attending this meetup event. See information above for instructions.

Where will it take place?
**Please join us online via Zoom.** A link to join will be provided when you RSVP.

All events are intended for women as leaders, mentors, members, and attendees. We are emphatically queer and trans friendly. Men are welcomed to attend *as guests* and must be accompanied by the R-Lady who invited them. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. If you would like to attend and feel excluded, please introduce yourself to an organizer.

title: Taiwan R User Group / MLDM Monday: MLDM Monday @ 三創育成 | Recommendation Systems in Real Life, Taiwan, Asia
group: Taiwan R User Group / MLDM Monday
description:
本次聚會地點於三創育成基金會（11F）場地

講題：Recommendation Systems in Real Life

講題介紹：
Recommendation systems are used everywhere nowadays. This talk will discuss how differently recommendation systems are researched and applied in academia and industry, and challenges one might face or criteria one might care about when building recommendation systems. In real life, the job of a recommendation algorithm is not to be very predictive of past held-out interactions but is to be predictive of future interactions. What is really important is its performance after being deployed, which is in the future. In addition, users change over time, items change over time, even the system around the recommendation algorithm is going to change over time, which might impact things and need to be considered. In this talk, we will talk about how we tackle some of these challenges and recent trends in personalization at Netflix.

講者介紹：
Ko-Jen (Mark) Hsiao is a senior research scientist at Netflix, where he researches and implements innovative algorithms to optimize Netflix's core personalization. He has extensive experiences in applying machine learning at scale, building and A/B testing ranking and recommendation systems. Before he joined Netflix, he was a data scientist at Whisper, an anonymous social network app with over 30 million monthly active users. He developed and implemented several end-to-end machine learning systems used by the company. He obtained his PhD from the University of Michigan, where he focused on combining disparate information for machine learning applications.

title: R-Ladies Boston: Tips and Tricks for Interactive HTML Tables with R  [Virtual] , United States, US/Canada
description:
Join us as Sharon Machlis (https://www.machlis.com/) shares her excitement about all the things you can do with interactive tables! (like put tiny, tiny plots into them!)

[Zoom link TBA]

About Sharon

Sharon is equally at home analyzing data, coding tools for journalists, and writing about technology. She is currently director of editorial data & analytics at IDG Communications, publisher of tech Web sites including Computerworld, CIO, PCWorld, and Macworld.

She has worked on data projects such as analyzing tens of thousands of tech visa applications. She has also taught both R and general data visualization at ProPublica, Investigative Reporters and Editors' Computer Assisted Reporting conferences, Boston University workshops, American Society of Business Press Editors webinars, and a national Journalism and Women Symposium.

She was previously executive editor, data & analytics at Computerworld, where she won the 2014 ASBPE national gold award for impact/investigative online excellence (see story) and the 2014 and 2017 ASBPE national golds for best how-to article (see 2014 and 2017 winners).

Sharon holds an Extra-class ham radio license and was honored by the Association of Radio Amateurs of Bosnia & Herzegovina "for extraordinary contribution to transmitting humanitarian messages of the citizens of Bosnia-Herzegovina" during the[masked] war.

Sharon's other hobbies include photography, travel, hiking, snowshoeing, and classical piano. And, she's somewhat obsessed with the R programming language.

Dean Attali (https://deanattali.com/) is a Shiny Consultant based in Canada. If you have you used Shiny, you will have almost certainly used one of Dean's packages.

Title: TBC, but something Shiny related

---
This talk will involve a significant amount of live coding around R & Shiny. While the talk will be suitable for everyone it is primarily aimed for participants with some experience in R and Shiny.
